data.title: If they sound familiar...
data.meta_description: Late last Christmas Day, a Mumsnetter went online to confess that she found Daddy Pig’s voice incredibly seductive: “That deep baritone... ‘Have you been a good girl today?’ [whimpers].”  Highbrow
data.text:
Late last Christmas Day, a Mumsnetter went online to confess that she found Daddy Pig’s voice incredibly seductive: “That deep baritone... ‘Have you been a good girl today?’ [whimpers].”

Highbrow Sunday Times Culture readers may think they have never heard the voice of Daddy Pig, who, as the father to cartoon character Peppa, is one of Britain’s biggest cultural exports; to toddlers, what Doctor Who and One Direction are to their tweenie elders. In fact, anyone who tuned in to the National Theatre’s 50th birthday celebrations will have seen the actor who voices him, Richard Ridings, on the Olivier stage.

Getting out to the theatre is a logistical challenge for most parents of young children, so it can be a happy reminder of an earlier
